name: ShadeDrops Broad Spectrum SPF 30 Mineral Milk Sunscreen
about: What it is:A lightweight, reef-friendly, SPF 30 mineral sunscreen that helps shield skin from UV rays and leaves skin with a soft, natural-looking finish..Skin Type:Normal, Dry, Combination, and Oily.Skincare Concerns:Dryness and Dullness.Formulation:Lightweight Serum.Highlighted Ingredients:- Zinc Oxide: Shields skin from damaging UV rays and is gentle enough for sensitive skin..Ingredient Callouts:This product is vegan, cruelty-free, and comes in recyclable packaging..What Else You Need to Know:This lightweight, reef-friendly, SPF 30 mineral sunscreen is enriched with vitamins, antioxidants, and soothing chamomile. It helps shield skin from harmful UV rays and leaves skin soft to the touch. Its naturally derived tint blends in beautifully with all skin tones for a natural-looking finish.
ingredients: -Zinc Oxide: Shields skin from damaging UV rays and is gentle enough for sensitive skin..-Squalane: Leaves skin appearing softer, smoother, and plumped up..-Antioxidant Complex (Vitamin E and Ethyl Ferulate): Helps protect skin against free-radical damage...Zinc Oxide 9.4%, Water, C12-15 Alkyl Benzoate,Sorbitan Oleate Decylglucoside Crosspolymer, Argania Spinosa Kernel Oil, Tocopheryl Acetate, Ammonium Acryloyldimethyltaurate/VP Copolymer, Glycerin, Caramel, Polyester-5, Squalane, Butyrospermum Parkii (Shea) Butter Extract, Bisabolol, Phospholipids, Tocopherol, Ethyl Ferulate, Urea, Ethylhexylglycerin, Gluconolactone, Triethoxycaprylylsilane, Dimethicone, Sodium Chloride, Benzyl Alcohol, Sodium Benzoate, Sorbic Acid, Chlorphenesin, Phenoxyethanol..... ......The list of ingredients is subject to change, please consult the packaging of the product purchased.
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.-Gently shake bottle and dispense nickel-size amount into hands..-Smooth evenly over skin as the final step in your skincare routine. .-Follow with makeup if desired..-Apply generously 15 minutes before sun exposure. .-Reapply every two hours, and directly after any physical activity or exposure to water.

reviews.review_title: The worst sunscreen I've ever used
reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: This is one of the worst sunscreens I've ever used. Let me preface by saying I do have very dry skin and typically prefer a more dewy look. Based off its description I assumed it would provide that, however I found it very dry and matte looking. That's not a problem though and more of a personal preference.  My issue with this product is how much it pills up. Dear word, the pilling is next level. It doesn't seem to matter what products I use underneath, this sunscreen will pill. Even without touching my face, I'll look in the mirror an hour later and notice that it's nothing but flaky and peeling. It also has a very waxy texture to it. It's hard to describe, but it really seems to just sit on top of my skin and not absorb at all. If I touch my face with this on, my hands will then be covered in this film and it even seems kind of soap resistant. I don't know what that's about but it's unpleasant. As I sit here, I touched my face briefly and am typing this out with wax fingers and a strong desire to wash both my face and hands.  I have not worn this under makeup, but I can't imagine it would go well and I won't be attempting it. It also smells really weird. I just don't have any positives to say about it. I have found drugstore sunscreens, even clean ones, that are much better and less expensive than this one. I could write a thesis on how much I dislike this sunscreen.
